title: Diplomacy takes center stage as Iran holds off retaliation against Israel
message:
U.S. assessments are that Iran will not seek to disrupt ongoing cease-fire negotiations in Doha aimed at ending the Hamas-Israel war.
Those technical talks could stretch into the weekend, but it is unclear how long Iran and its proxies may hold off.
A U.S. official confirmed to CBS News that Israel was responsible for Haniyeh's killing, though Israel has not publicly acknowledged it.
A U.K. official told CBS News, "Our core focus is diplomatic efforts and de-escalation.
A French official also told CBS News, "We've been calling on all actors in the region to de-escalate.

title: Casualty Toll Of Russian Attack On Enterprise In Kharkiv Region Rises
message:
(MENAFN- UkrinForm) The number those as a result of a Russian on a civil enterprise in the village of Prylokotne of the Kupiansk district in Kharkiv region has increased to six.
That's according to the press service of the Kharkiv Regional Prosecutor's Office , Ukrinform reports.
"The number of injured has increased to six.
A 47-year-old man - also an employee of the enterprise that was hit by the enemy airstrike - sought medical assistance," the update reads.
Russian strike kills two in, Donetsk regionAs Ukrinform reported earlier, on August 15, at around 15:20, the Russian invasion forces launched airstrikes on the village of Prykolotne in the Kupiansk district, hitting a civil enterprise.

White House National Security Council spokesman John Kirby told CNN on Thursday that US intelligence indicates that Iran has not backed down from its threat to attack Israel.
There have been conflicting reports as to whether Tehran will attack Israel in retaliation for the elimination of Hamas political leader Ismail Haniyeh on July 31.
On Tuesday, three senior Iranian officials told Reuters that Iran could delay or cancel its planned attack against Israel if this week's ceasefire talks between Israel and Hamas are successful.
Later in the day, US President Joe Biden said that he expects Iran to back down from its threats to attack Israel if a ceasefire deal with Hamas is reached this week.
“That’s my expectation,” Biden told reporters when asked if he believes Iran will not strike if a deal is signed.

title: Ukraine surprise advance into Russia a dilemma for Biden
message:
The same goes for White House policy on Ukrainian attacks into Russian territory.
For many months President Zelensky pleaded for permission to strike at military targets in Russia that facilitated attacks into Ukraine.
"We're not authorising strikes 200 miles into Russia and we're not authorising strikes on Moscow, on the Kremlin."
Since then, Mr Zelensky, along with some European allies and some Democrats in Washington, have urged the US to further “untie” Ukraine’s hands.
The words he used in June suggested that Ukraine’s limits were “in proximity to the border”.

title: A closer look at Hezbollah tunnel threat
message:
Some Israeli analysts say Hezbollah's tunnel network is even more extensive than the one built by Hamas.
This could prove significant because it could help Hezbollah maintain resupply routes from Iraq and Syria in the event of an all-out war.
The tunnel network would make it very difficult to preemptively attack Hezbollah's stock of rockets and missiles, which is far larger than that of Hamas.
It has spent much of the last two decades preparing for a potential war, with assistance from Iran, Syria and Russia.
"We're not counting on anything when it comes to Iran and the possibility of some sort of an attack," Kirby said.

title: Russian attack on Sumy Oblast kills 1 , injures 3
message:
Russian forces attacked 11 communities in Sumy Oblast on Aug. 15, killing one and injuring three people, the Sumy Oblast Military Administration reported.
The security situation in Sumy Oblast became more tense with the start of Ukraine's cross-border incursion into neighboring Kursk Oblast in Russia, which began on Aug. 6.
Sumy Oblast borders Russia's Bryansk, Kursk, and Belgorod oblasts.
Civilians in Sumy Oblast within 20 kilometers (12 miles) of the border with Kursk Oblast are now subject to restrictions on movement due to increasing Russian attacks, according to the General Staff of Ukraine's Armed Forces.

title: Ex - Israeli min . mocks Netanyahu , urges him to  be brave
message:
A new round of Gaza cease-fire and prisoner swap talks began Thursday in the Qatari capital Doha to reach an agreement between Israel and Hamas.
Hamas said on Wednesday that it will participate in the upcoming Gaza cease-fire and hostage swap talks if Israel provides a clear commitment to implement U.S. President Joe Biden's proposal.
But mediation efforts have been stalled due to Netanyahu’s refusal to meet Hamas’ demands to stop the war.
Flouting a U.N. Security Council resolution demanding an immediate cease-fire, Israel has faced international condemnation amid its continued brutal offensive on Gaza since an Oct. 7, 2023 attack by Hamas.
Over 10 months into the Israeli onslaught, vast tracts of Gaza lie in ruins amid a crippling blockade of food, clean water and medicine.

title: Secret Service OKs plan for Trump to continue outdoor rallies
message:
WASHINGTON: The U.S. Secret Service has approved a new plan for Republican presidential candidate Donald Trump to continue outdoor rallies in the wake of a July assassination attempt, the Washington Post reported on Thursday.
The Secret Service did not immediately respond to a request for comment on the Washington Post report.
FBI officials have yet to identify a motive for the suspected shooter, 20-year-old Thomas Crooks, who was shot dead by a Secret Service agent after opening fire.
Following the attack, the Secret Service recommended that Trump avoid large outdoor events.
Trump subsequently said he would continue outdoor rallies and that the Secret Service had “agreed to substantially step up their operation” to protect him.

title: Judge finds Callum Cameron guilty for murder of mother Carol Cameron
message:
Callum Cameron woke his mother up on the night of August 10, 2020, to tell her he was overdosing on drugs and needed help.
Carol Cameron, 63, was a former nurse.
Callum Cameron stabbed his mum 63 times in a drug-induced psychosis.
Credit: FacebookAfter they arrived, he stabbed her 62 times in an attack so violent and disturbing a jury was spared the details in a judge-only trial.
But on Friday a Supreme Court judge found the 31-year-old guilty of her murder despite his claims he could not remember it.

title: He Was Looking For HIMARS Near Pokrovsk : SSU Detains Taxi Driver Who Spied For Russians
message:
(MENAFN- UkrinForm) The Security Service of Ukraine (SSU) has detained a Russian informant who, under the guise of a taxi driver, was collecting intelligence for the invaders in Donetsk region, in particular, tracking the basing points of HIMARS missile systems in the Pokrovsk direction.
According to Ukrinform, this was reported by the SSU .
The Russians needed the intelligence to prepare new offensive operations and missile strikes in this area of the frontline.
To collect the information needed by the invaders, the man travelled around the area under the guise of a taxi driver, asking his passengers for information in the dark.
He was an active user of a Russian telegram bot that collects information about the deployment of the Ukrainian Armed Forces on the eastern front.

title: Secret Service approves bulletproof glass to shield Trump at outdoor rallies
message:
WASHINGTON — The Secret Service will use ballistic glass to protect former President Donald Trump so he can resume outdoor campaign events, according to two sources familiar with the planning and a Trump campaign official.
The official said the Secret Service is also increasing staffing and technology to mitigate threats around Trump during outdoor rallies, as well as more increasing threat analysis and prevention for all protective details, including deploying counter-snipers and countersurveillance.
The Secret Service faced intense scrutiny and criticism after a gunman fired multiple times at Trump during an outdoor rally in Butler, Pennsylvania, on July 13, wounding him and two rallygoers and killing another person.
Former Secret Service Director Kimberly Cheatle said after the shooting, which led to her resignation, that she was bolstering the protective details of the candidates for president.
Trump has not held an outdoor campaign event since the attempted assassination.

title: Report points at Kyiv role in Nord Stream blasts ; Ukraine denies
message:
Ukrainian presidential adviser Mykhailo Podolyak Thursday denied his country's involvement in explosions which damaged the Nord Stream 2 gas pipeline .
The pipelines, transporting gas under the Baltic Sea, were ruptured by explosions in Sept 2022.
However, Ukraine blamed Russia.
"Such an act can only be carried out with extensive technical and financial resources ... and who possessed all this at the time of the bombing?
Only Russia," Podolyak said.

message:
Three Questions to WatchCan Ukraine’s strike into Russia’s Kursk region force Russia to slow its attacks in Ukraine’s Donbas?
In recent weeks, Russia has made slow, steady advances in Ukraine’s eastern Donbas region, threatening the towns of Niu-York, Pokrovsk and Chasiv Yar.
Ukraine’s latest conscription efforts have proven unpopular and a weary population has questioned whether continuing the war makes sense.
The Russian illegal annexation of Donetsk and Luhansk (and Ukraine’s Kherson and Zaporizhia provinces) codified this reality in Russian minds.
Ukraine’s recent attack into Russia’s internationally recognized territory may seem less distinct or new to those Russians who have fully imbibed Putin’s worldview.

title: Lamine Yamal father was stabbed after being  tricked  into meeting
message:
Barcelona star Lamine Yamal's father was stabbed after being tricked into meeting up with four men who fooled him into thinking they wanted to 'make peace' following a confrontation hours earlier, it was claimed last night.
The four members of the same family surrounded the Spanish international's father and started to punch and kick him before one allegedly stabbed him, the paper reported.
Wednesday night's stabbing in a car park in Mataro north of Barcelona followed an incident around 3pm earlier the same day.
Mounir spent a night in intensive care at Germans Trias i Pujol Hospital in Barcelona before being transferred to a normal ward.
Barcelona president Joan Laporta was among those who visited him on Wednesday night in hospital following the stabbing.

title: Palestinian death toll in Gaza exceeds 40 , 000 as peace talks renew
message:
Palestinian death toll in Gaza exceeds 40,000 as peace talks renewXinhua) 08:09, August 16, 2024People mourn victims killed in an Israeli airstrike in the southern Gaza Strip city of Khan Younis, on Aug. 14, 2024.
(Photo by Rizek Abdeljawad/Xinhua)GAZA, Aug. 15 (Xinhua) -- The Palestinian death toll from the ongoing Israeli attacks on the Gaza Strip has surpassed 40,000 as of Thursday, at a time when the Gaza ceasefire talks were set to resume in Qatar.
It took only five and a half months for the Palestinian death toll in the Gaza Strip to rise from 30,000 to 40,000.
A man stands among the rubble after an Israeli airstrike in the Nuseirat refugee camp, central Gaza Strip, on Aug. 12, 2024.
The Israel Defense Forces (IDF) said in a statement on Thursday that it is continuing operational activity in the Gaza Strip, "eliminating terrorists and dismantling terrorist infrastructure."

title: Watch : Russian Strategic Bomber Crashes In Siberia
message:
A Russian long-range strategic bomber has crashed over the Siberian region of Irkutsk in what was described as a routine flight.
Russian state media was the first to report and confirm the crash, citing military officials.
"The plane crashed in an uninhabited area.
Identified as a nuclear-capable Tu-22M3 bomber, military officials say that the crash was due to technical malfunction.
More footage shows a plummeting plane which is on fire in Russia's far east...Reports that a Russian Tu-22M3 bomber crashed in Irkutsk Oblast, Russia tonight.

title: Court of Appeals reverses conviction for former Lexington High School student found guilty in 2014 deadly stabbing
message:
COLUMBIA, S.C. (WIS) - The South Carolina Court of Appeals reversed the conviction of a man who was found guilty in the deadly stabbing of a Dutch Fork High School student.
“A mistrial is the equivalent of no trial and leaves the cause pending in the circuit court,” the South Carolina Court of Appeals said in court documents.
In reversing his conviction, the South Carolina Court of Appeals ordered the trial court to give Dennis a new immunity hearing.
Ultimately, the South Carolina Court of Appeals found the proper course was to remand for a new immunity hearing.
“The circuit court is in the best position to assess witness credibility and make the necessary findings of fact,” said the South Carolina Court of Appeals in the court documents.

title: China military AI detects secret radar links between South China Sea , Alaska and Guam
message:
Chinese electronic warfare AI has detected mysterious signals that repeatedly show up in the South China Sea, Guam , the Marshall Islands and the Aleutian Islands near Alaska – and they appear to be coordinated.
They published their findings in a peer-reviewed paper in the Journal of Terahertz Science and Electronic Information Technology in May.
This information helps the Chinese military better plan electronic warfare tasks such as electromagnetic suppression, deception, and jamming.
The electronic warfare AI works with other intelligence platforms, such as imaging satellites, to cross-check its findings.
The PLA’s electronic warfare equipment has made rapid progress in recent years, and its electronic warfare strategy has become proactive, while the United States sometimes finds itself on the defensive.

title: Supercarrier USS George H . W . Bush Now Has First Of its Kind Drone Control Center
message:
Bush (CVN-77) is now the first U.S. Navy supercarrier to have a complete dedicated Unmanned Air Warfare Center (UAWC).
Bush (CVN-77) is now the first U.S. Navy supercarrier to have a complete dedicated Unmanned Air Warfare Center (UAWC).
Naval Air Systems Command (NAVAIR) announced the completion of George H.W.

The Navy has now taken a major step forward toward its larger uncrewed naval aviation vision with the completion of the new drone control center on the USS George H.W.

title: Ottawa : Ukraine can use military equipment in Russia
message:
OTTAWA -The federal government says the Ukrainian army can use military equipment provided by Canada inside Russia.
A spokesperson for National Defence says Canada places no geographic restrictions on military equipment donated to Ukraine.
The statement comes after Ukraine launched a surprise military offensive into Russia earlier this month.
The attack is unprecedented for its use of Ukrainian military units on Russian soil.
Ottawa has committed $4 billion in military assistance to Ukraine through 2029.

message:

title: Hyped Modern Warfare 2 Remastered Multiplayer Mod Killed One Day Before Launch
message:
The highly anticipated fan mod for Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare Remastered was focused on recreating and remastering the online multiplayer of Modern Warfare 2 for PC players.
CoD4: MW Remastered launched in 2016 and included the original campaign as well as a remastered version of that game’s beloved multiplayer mode.
However, when Modern Warfare 2 Remastered arrived in 2020, it only included the campaign and didn’t feature any online multiplayer.
For many players, this was extremely disappointing ,as MW2’s online multiplayer is considered by many CoD fans to be the best in the franchise’s history.
So many people bought MW Remastered because of the mod that it jumped into the top five best-selling games on Steam.

title: The Ukrainian August 2024 offensive : Some initial thoughts
message:
It is the most significant development in the Ukraine war in over a year.
Some observations of the Ukrainian August offensive:The Ukrainians practiced good OPSEC – The offensive came as surprise to many observers in the West (including myself) and that’s good.
In this “You Tube” war where truth is hard to discern due to the exaggerated claims of everyone posting, the current Ukrainian offensive does appear to have done well in this regard.
The Ukrainians now hold Russian territory as a bargaining chip for negotiations – This is a huge development.
Provides morale boost for Ukrainian forces, nation and international supporters – The success of this offensive has been a huge shot in the arm for Ukraine.

title: The Underwater Pipelines That Supplied Fuel For The Allied Invasion Of Normandy
message:
This pipeline network, known as the Government Pipeline Storage System (GPSS) pipeline, formed the backbone of the PLUTO pipelines.
The PLUTO pipelines were not, it should be said, the main means by which petroleum was to be supplied to the continent in this scenario.
Library of Congress via Wikimedia Commons A map of the PLUTO pipelines.
Work on the PLUTO pipeline relied on the Allies capturing Cherbourg harbor intact in only eight days.
In May 1945, Churchill himself suggested that Operation PLUTO was “a wholly British achievement and a piece of amphibious engineering skill of which we may well be proud.”Ultimately, Operation PLUTO was less successful than the British authorities envisioned in 1942 and 1943.

message:
The highly anticipated fan mod for Call of Duty 4: Modern Warfare Remastered was focused on recreating and remastering the online multiplayer of Modern Warfare 2 for PC players.
This Modern Warfare 3 Gameplay Feature Spices Up A Weak Campaign CC Share Subtitles OffEnglish view video This Modern Warfare 3 Gameplay Feature Spices Up A Weak CampaignThis Modern Warfare 3 Gameplay Feature Spices Up A Weak Campaign CC Share Subtitles OffEnglish This Modern Warfare 3 Gameplay Feature Spices Up A Weak CampaignCoD4: MW Remastered launched in 2016 and included the original campaign as well as a remastered version of that game’s beloved multiplayer mode.
However, when Modern Warfare 2 Remastered arrived in 2020, it only included the campaign and didn’t feature any online multiplayer.
So many people bought MW Remastered because of the mod that it jumped into the top five best-selling games on Steam.
Currently, MW Remastered has a “mostly negative” review status on Steam.

title: Massive new Navy ship leaves San Diego Bay for its first sea trials
message:
The USNS Robert E. Simanek, a 784-foot expeditionary sea base, left the General Dynamics-NASSCO shipyard in San Diego Bay on Wednesday for its first sea trial, considered an important step in preparing a vessel for full service.
The Simanek is the fifth ESB that NASSCO has built for the Navy, which intends to use the vessels to help deploy troops and equipment in areas of the world where the U.S. doesn’t have easy access to land bases and seaports.
The ship carries the designation USNS because it is a non-commissioned vessel that will be operated for the Navy by a civilian crew under the Military Sealift Command.
NASSCO said the ship was named in honor of the late Robert Ernest Simanek, a private first class Marine who was awarded the Medal of Honor for shielding fellow Marines during a grenade attack in the Battle of Bunker Hill during the Korean War.

title: Zelenskyy says Ukrainian troops are consolidating control of Russian territory
message:
Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Thursday that his country's troops had taken full control of Sudzha, the largest Russian town to fall to Ukraine's forces since the start of their cross-border incursion more than a week ago.
“The more Russian military presence is destroyed in the border regions, the closer peace and real security will be for our state.
Meanwhile, Russian forces are keeping up the pressure on the southern and eastern front lines, according to Ukrainian military officials.
As of Thursday, the Ukrainian military claims to be holding more than 80 towns and settlements in the Kursk region.
Russian military bloggers reported that small Ukrainian mechanized groups have continued to probe Russian defenses.

title: Cyber - attack could trigger ANZUS treaty , Australia , NZ leaders say
message:
A﻿ "sufficiently severe" cyber attack on either country could trigger a combined Australia-New Zealand defence response, the prime ministers of both countries said today.
New Zealand Prime Minister Christopher Luxon.
(9News)Luxon confirmed ﻿that the alliance could "come into play" in the face of a "sufficiently severe cyber attack".
A "severe" cyber attack could provoke a joint Australia-NZ defence response.
"Prime Minister Albanese and I agreed to engage closely on this," he said.

title: What does Chicago represent for the Democratic National Convention ?
message:
But for all the ways Chicago represents Democratic ideals, critics say it has also exemplified the party’s failings and divisions.
Looming large over the upcoming Democratic National Convention is the spectre of an earlier convention in Chicago that ended in unrest and violence.
Still, the party assembled in Chicago for its 1968 Democratic National Convention.
Hundreds of demonstrators are expected to gather outside the 2024 convention site to protest Democratic support for Israel’s war in Gaza.
Still, Cowan said the current optimism surrounding the Harris-Walz campaign may overshadow any protests outside this year’s convention in Chicago.

title: Jewish Voices for Trump  coalition formed to combat antisemitism
message:
A 95-year-old Auschwitz survivor was among guests at an event in New Jersey Thursday night as former President Donald Trump launched following recent attacks on members of the Jewish community.
"They're going loco," Trump said of pro-Palestine protesters, using the Spanish word that means crazy or unhinged.
It’s with the Republican Party, and with President Donald J. Trump," the release continued.
"'Jewish Voices for Trump' comes together with one voice, to make sure that President Donald J. Trump becomes the next President of the United States."
Trump, meanwhile, reportedly suggested Vice President Kamala Harris “doesn’t like Jewish people” even though her husband, second gentleman Doug Emhoff, is Jewish.

title: Israel has hit a wall in Gaza , some US officials say , as civilian deaths mount
message:
Israel has hit a wall in Gaza, some US officials say, as civilian deaths mountWASHINGTON − Israel has achieved most of its battlefield aims against Hamas in Gaza, but is unlikely to eliminate the militant movement by continuing combat operations that have cost an estimated 40,000 lives, current and former U.S. officials say.
Iranian officials have said a Gaza cease-fire would temper their promised response to the assassination, which they blame on Israel.
While U.S. arms sales continue, some officials are questioning whether Israel’s military has hit a wall in Gaza.
“There is no such thing as total victory in the context of the Gaza war."
This article originally appeared on USA TODAY: Israel has hit a wall in Gaza, US officials say; deaths hit 40,000

title: Echoes of  68 as Chicago convention looms for Democrats
message:
"It's not a twin, but an echo," David Farber, a University of Kansas history professor and author of the book "Chicago '68," said of circumstances connecting the two conventions.
He pointed to the choice of Chicago as a way for Democrats to exorcise the demons of the past.
"I thought, 'Oh, the ghost of '68 is really over' -- and then all the protests broke out on university campuses over the Gaza-Israel situation" and word came that massive demonstrations await the upcoming convention, Farber told AFP.
As AFP reported from Chicago just before the 1968 convention opened on August 26, the Democratic Party "appears more divided than ever."
"It's more a story of contrasts," said historian Frank Kusch who wrote "Battleground Chicago," a book about the 1968 convention.

title: Mastering Threats Beneath Waves
message:
To help counteract this threat, two Royal Australian Navy sailors recently participated in the Royal Navy's advanced mine warfare course at HMS Collingwood in England.
Warrant Officer Lockard and Chief Petty Officer Cochrane learned planning considerations, including how to identify areas likely to be mined, best patterns of search to identify targets and best available disposal methods.
"The course is designed for us to conduct practical planning for the execution of mine warfare operations," Warrant Officer Lockard said.
Both sailors are now qualified to work as mine warfare planners within maritime task groups.
"I am looking forward to using my new knowledge and skills to overcome challenges with mine countermeasures operations," Chief Petty Officer Cochrane said.

title: Ukraine cross - border incursion challenges Moscow war narrative – but will it shift Russian opinion ?
message:
The attack caught the Russian armed forces by surprise, and they have struggled to eject the Ukrainians from Russian territory.
Ukraine’s invasion of Kursk may shock the Russian leaders – and public – out of their complacency and disrupt the status quo.
Beyond that crude “rally around the flag” effect, however, the Russian public has not shown any great enthusiasm for the war.
In that June poll, 65% blamed the West for starting the war, 11% blamed Ukraine, and only 6% blamed Russia.
Adrejosons has found that indifference and acquiescence are the prevailing mood in the Russian public.

title: Kyodo News Digest : Aug . 16 , 2024
message:
KYODO NEWS - 6 hours ago - 07:21 | All, World, JapanThe following is the latest list of selected news summaries by Kyodo News.
Real gross domestic product marked the first increase in two quarters, rebounding from a sharp contraction in the first three months of 2024.
On a nominal basis, Japan's GDP topped 600 trillion yen ($4 trillion) for the first time, amid persisting inflation caused by a weakening yen.
----------Thai coalition parties to nominate Thaksin's daughter as PM candidateBANGKOK - Thailand's ruling coalition on Thursday decided to nominate Paetongtarn Shinawatra, daughter of former Prime Minister Thaksin Shinawatra, as its candidate for prime minister, her party said.
The decision to endorse the leader of the Pheu Thai Party for a parliamentary vote scheduled on Friday follows a Constitutional Court ruling dismissing Prime Minister Srettha Thavisin over an ethical violation related to his appointment of a minister.

title: Biden still believes he would beat Trump if hed stayed in the race : report
message:
At the time he dropped out of the 2024 presidential race, President Biden believed he could beat former President Trump.
The Biden administration would support the elimination of taxes on tipped wages, an idea first proposed by former President Trump, the White House said.
President Biden during the White House Creator Economy Conference in the Indian Treaty Room of the White House in Washington, DC, US, on Wednesday, Aug. 14, 2024.
Fox News Digital reached out to the White House for comment, but did not immediately receive a response.
Original article source: Biden still believes he would beat Trump if he'd stayed in the race: report

title: Six Jews Youths Arrested Trying to Mark 19 Years Since Expulsion from Gaza | The Jewish Press - JewishPress . com | Jewish News Syndicate ( JNS ) | 12 Av 5784 – Friday , August 16 , 2024
message:
Israeli security forces arrested six youths after dozens tried to breach the border with the Gaza Strip to conduct a Jewish prayer service there on Thursday morning.
AdvertisementThe six who were detained were part of a group of some 40 people who tried to enter the Strip from the Erez Crossing with northern Gaza.
The attempt to enter the enclave came as resettlement activists marked 19 years since the military carried out Israel’s disengagement from the Gaza Strip, in which more than 8,000 Jews were forcibly removed from their homes.
“Only a Jewish Gaza will remove the threats of missiles and hostage-taking from Gaza and bring security to the residents of the south and the entire country,” the anonymous Israeli worshipper continued.
“If you mean resettling Gaza, … it was never in the cards, and I said so openly.

title: Global corporations versus nation - states
message:
In today’s interconnected world, the influence of monopolistic corporations has grown to staggering levels, especially through global communication channels.
Even after it was confirmed that the attacker was a Christian, the unrest continued to escalate, fueled by the unchecked spread of inflammatory content on social media.
Currently, China dominates the global market in lithium processing and battery production, but this supply chain is vulnerable.
Musk, often lauded for his efforts to champion “free speech” on X, is clearly intoxicated by the vast opportunities presented by the global lithium race.
If he, with all his wealth and power, is so consumed by this pursuit, one can only imagine the lengths to which other global media magnates might go to secure their share.

title: Ukraine can use Canadian military equipment inside Russia , Ottawa says
message:
OTTAWA — The federal government says the Ukrainian army can use military equipment provided by Canada inside Russia.
A spokesperson for National Defence says Canada places no geographic restrictions on military equipment donated to Ukraine.
OTTAWA — The federal government says the Ukrainian army can use military equipment provided by Canada inside Russia.
A spokesperson for National Defence says Canada places no geographic restrictions on military equipment donated to Ukraine.
The attack is unprecedented for its use of Ukrainian military units on Russian soil.
